subject: Philosophy
title: Philosophy vs. Religion
description: A quick win: understand Philosophy vs. Religion.

hook.text: Both philosophy and religion ask the biggest questions. But they start from different places.

buildup.text: Religion often begins with revealed truth ‚Äî sacred texts, prophets, divine authority.

discovery.text: Philosophy begins with doubt. Nothing is assumed true until reason supports it.

twist.text: Yet many great philosophers were religious. Aquinas fused Christian faith with Aristotle.

climax.text: The tension isn't belief vs. unbelief. It's whether you start with faith or with questions.

punchline.text: One starts with answers. The other with doubt.

quiz.question: Which philosopher fused Christian theology with Aristotelian philosophy?
